etymologies: late 19th century (originally US, denoting prepared foods for sale): from German Delikatessen or Dutch delicatessen, from French délicatesse ‘delicateness’, from délicat (see delicate)

definitions: a store selling cold cuts, cheeses, and a variety of salads, as well as a selection of unusual or foreign prepared foods.
shortDefinitions: shop selling cooked meats, cheeses, and unusual or foreign prepared foods
